It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.   How to contribute to our visionWithin our department we are currently looking for a dedicated Project Manager to lead complex projects within the Major Projects team in NE&ME Continental region. The Project Manager designs, develops and manages such projects, according to defined Project Management (PM) standards, stakeholder requirements and Business Conduct Guidelines (e.g. Tax regulations, Export Control, EHS). Additionally, you will take over the following tasks:Full project responsibility in terms of time, cost and quality delivered - from scoping phase until project closure.
Ensure EHS standards, procedures and EHS plans are implemented at project sites to create a Home Safe environment.
Define the technical project scope together with the technical department and support the tender process together with procurement.
Support the CPM with the budget and cost planning structure, risk analysis and contingency plan.
Plan resources, cranes, platforms, material & tools and logistics for the execution.
Execute the project according to agreed working packages, budget and timeline.
Control, prepare and maintain the project status (financially as well as technically), monitor milestones and adherence to budgets, and initiates actions to minimize non-conformance cost.
Contract and claim management of your project and initiate corrective actions where necessary.
Manage and align the projects different stakeholders e.g. suppliers, service providers, official authorities, customers or internal stakeholders.
Lead the daily project execution and stakeholder engagement activities.
Support on internal improvement, quality and standardization projects.What you need to make a differencePassion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. Additionally, you fit to the following requirements:You hold a university degree or relevant work experience (technical or commercial studies incl. project management courses), preferably with a focus on the wind business.
You gained several years of working experience with project management - preferably of international service/repair projects - with multiple stakeholders and suppliers. It is an advantage if you have documented your experience through relevant Project Management Certification.
Experience of managing 3rd party contractors always ensuring performance meets required standard with regards to Safety and Quality.
Excellent English language skills, both orally and in writing. Spanish language skills, both orally and in writing, would be an advantage.
You have a structured approach to your assignments (incl. structured documentation) and can handle project scope changes occurring in a dynamic, multicultural environment to the full satisfaction of your stakeholders.
You are able to apply the commercial angle into the project to deliver projects on target cost.
You thrive in a multi-cultural environment, and you are familiar with working in large matrix organizations.
You are prepared for travelling.In return of your commitment we offer you…Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come
A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy
Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality
Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization
Employer-funded pension
Attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable)
